revised_title: Investigation of Mixtures of Azobenzene and Benzylaniline: Freezing, Melting Point Curves, and Supersolubility
tldr: This study investigates the freezing, melting point curves, and curve of spontaneous crystallization of mixtures of azobenzene and benzylaniline. The authors found that these mixtures form a continuous series of mixed crystals with a minimum eutectic freezing point. The results provide insights into the behavior of mixtures of substances that form mixed crystals and have implications for understanding phase transitions and crystallography.
